column1: 0106|six minutes past one|We had come out of church together after midnight service and had immediately seen the offending light
column2: as had most of the congregation. And Bill
column4: had looked at his watch. His call to the manor had been made at six minutes past one.

column1: 0106|1:06|When he woke it was 1:06 by the digital clock on the bedside table. He lay there looking at the ceiling
column2: the raw glare of the vaporlamp outside bathing the bedroom in a cold and bluish light. Like a winter moon.
